title: American_Top_40_1980_April_26th
description:
"Every week on American Top 40, we countdown the biggest hits in America as determined by the official Billboard survey."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Bette Midler debuts her song "The Rose" at number 39, and The Clash debuts with their very first American hit, "Train In Vain" at number 38.

Casey tells whatever became of C. W. McCall, the artist who had a number one hit in 1976 called "Convoy."

A listener wants to know, "Who has hit number one most often, male singers or female singers?" Casey gives the statistics.

Casey also answers the question, "What has been the highest debuting song by a new artist?" This song, which debuted on the hot 100 at number 23, is played as an in-show extra.

LW#3: Ride Like The Wind - Christopher Cross
LW#2: Another Brick In The Wall - Pink Floyd
LW#1: Call Me - Blondie
